issuetype.name: Bug

resolution.description: Is not a bug in our product
resolution.name: Not Our Bug

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.
status.name: Resolved

components.name: Titanium SDK & CLI
components.description: Please enter tickets related to the MobileSDK here.

fields.description:
Found these errors after I upgrade to titanium SDK 7.2.0.GA

[ERROR] :  Found incompatible Titanium Modules:
[ERROR] :     id: dk.napp.drawer	 version: 1.1.6	 platform: android	 min sdk: 4.1.0.GA
[ERROR] :     id: com.tripvi.drawerlayout	 version: 1.1.1	 platform: android	 min sdk: 3.3.0
[ERROR] :     id: nl.vanvianen.android.gcm	 version: 1.1	 platform: android	 min sdk: 3.5.1
[ERROR] :     id: com.plotprojects.ti	 version: 1.10.1	 platform: android	 min sdk: 3.1.3.GA
[ERROR] :     id: com.plotprojects.ti.androidibeacons	 version: 1.6.7	 platform: android	 min sdk: 3.1.3.GA
[ERROR] :     id: crittercism	 version: 1.0.1	 platform: android	 min sdk: 3.0.0
[ERROR] :     id: com.liferay.beacons	 version: 0.3	 platform: android	 min sdk: 3.2.2.GA
[ERROR] Application Installer abnormal process termination. Process exit value was 1
fields.summary: After upgrading to 7.2.0.GA It gives me Titanium module error

comments.body: From which version did you update? The error suggests modules that are not compatible with SDK 7+ so far. But in fact, you just need to update the modules to versions that are supported and you'll be good to go.
